sen.j: 本貫（ほんがん/うぶすな）は、中国・朝鮮半島及び日本の律令制で戸籍に記載された本籍地のことをいう。
sen.e: Hongan (also called Ubusuna) refers to the registered address on the family register in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo code) in China, the Korean Peninsula and Japan.

Hongan (also called Ubusuna) refers to the registered address on the family register under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo code) in China, the Korean Peninsula, and Japan.
sen.cmt: 間違いではありませんが、underを用いた方がより分かり易い文になるかと考え修正致しました。
sen.e: Hongan (also called Ubusuna) refers to the registered address on the family register under the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the Ritsuryo code) in China, the Korean Peninsula, and Japan.

sen.j: 転じて、姓氏や氏族集団の発祥の地を指すようになった。
sen.e: This was extended to indicate the birthplace of the family name or the clan.
This was extended to indicate the birthplace of the family name or the clan.
This was extended to indicate the birthplace of the family name or the clan.

sen.j: 日本では、武家が「名字（苗字）の地」を「本貫」「本貫地」と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: In Japan, samurai families called their 'place of the surname' 'hongan' or 'honganchi (place of hongan).'
In Japan, samurai families called their 'place of the surname' 'hongan' or 'honganchi (place of hongan).'
In Japan, samurai families called their 'place of the surname' 'hongan' or 'honganchi (place of hongan).'

sen.j: 海外では、現在でも朝鮮半島で行われている、氏族の始祖の発祥地を表す用法が知られている。
sen.e: The usage as the birthplace of the earliest ancestor of the clan, still used in the Korean Peninsula is known outside Japan.
Outside of Japan, hongan is known to be used as an expression for the birthplace of the clan's originator, which is still being put in use in the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: 「現在でも」[表す」が訳漏れでした。
sen.e: Outside of Japan, hongan is known to be used as an expression for the birthplace of the clan's originator, which is still being put in use in the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 中国では、戸籍が置かれた場所、ないし、それから派生した用法（始祖の出自の場所など）で使用される。
sen.e: In China, it is used as the place of the family register or the usage derived from it (such as the birthplace of the earliest ancestor).
In China, it is used as the place where the family register is registered, or in ways (such as the birthplace of the originator) that derived from the use already described.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: In China, it is used as the place where the family register is registered, or in ways (such as the birthplace of the originator) that derived from the use already described.

tit.cmt: 間違いではありませんが、underを使うとより原文に近付くと考えました。

sen.j: 日本では、大宝律令制定とともに本貫制が導入された。
sen.e: In Japan, the Hongan system was introduced along with the establishment of Taiho Ritsuryo.
In Japan, the Hongan system was introduced with the establishment of the Taiho Ritsuryo.
sen.cmt: alongを削除し、withのみで平易な文に致しました。
sen.e: In Japan, the Hongan system was introduced with the establishment of the Taiho Ritsuryo.

sen.j: 人々は本貫地の戸籍・計帳に載せられて勝手に本貫地を離れることは浮浪として禁じられていた。
sen.e: People were registered on the family register and the tax register in their honganchi, and leaving there without permission was called vagrancy and was prohibited.
People were placed on the family register and the tax register of their honganchi, and leaving the honganchi without permission was considered as vagrancy and was prohibited.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: People were placed on the family register and the tax register of their honganchi, and leaving the honganchi without permission was considered as vagrancy and was prohibited.

sen.j: 逃走の戸は3年、戸口は6年が経過すると戸籍・計帳から除かれて絶貫（本貫を持たない者）となった。
sen.e: In three years after a family escaped, or six years after a family member escaped, they were removed from their family register and tax register and became 絶貫 (person without having the birthplace).
sen.cmt: 絶貫 読み不明です。
sen.e: Three years after a family's escape, and six years after the escape of a member of the family, they were removed from the family and tax register, and became 絶貫 (a person without a birthplace).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Three years after a family's escape, and six years after the escape of a member of the family, they were removed from the family and tax register, and became 絶貫 (a person without a birthplace).

sen.j: その後、逃走者が発見された場合には逃亡先の戸籍に編入させられる「当所編附」あるいは元の本貫地への強制送還させられる「本貫還附」の措置が取られた（ただし、陸奥国・出羽国の本貫者については「本貫還附」が決められていた）。
sen.e: Later, some measures were taken; 'tosho henpu' that the escaper was incorporated in the family register of the place he fled to when he was founded, and 'hongan kanpu' that the escaper was deported to his original honganchi (The people with hongan in Mutsu Province and Dewa Province were required to have 'hongan kanpu,' though.)

Later, when those that fled were found, measures either 'tosho henpu' that made them admitted to the family register that they had fled to, or 'hongan kanpu' that had them deported back to their original honganchi, was taken (however, for people with hongan in Mutsu Province and Dewa Province, 'hongan kanpu' was taken).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Later, when those that fled were found, measures either 'tosho henpu' that made them admitted to the family register that they had fled to, or 'hongan kanpu' that had them deported back to their original honganchi, was taken (however, for people with hongan in Mutsu Province and Dewa Province, 'hongan kanpu' was taken).

sen.j: また養老4年（720年）以後は逃走者の自主的帰還（「走還」）を促すために走還した者の課役を1年間免除する措置を取った。
sen.e: After 720, a measure that the labor duty of the escaper returning voluntarily ('sokan') was exempted for one year to encourage escapers to do sokan.
Also, the measure to exempt the returnees from a year of labor was taken to encourage voluntary return ('sokan') of those that fled.
sen.cmt: 「また」が訳漏れでしたので補いました。
sen.e: Also, the measure to exempt the returnees from a year of labor was taken to encourage voluntary return ('sokan') of those that fled.

sen.j: また、大学寮の学生が退学した場合は本貫に通告すること（学令）、徴発された労役者が帰還前に死亡した場合には本貫に通告すること（賦役令）、本主が死亡した帳内・資人は本貫に送還すること（選叙令）、病気になって倒れた防人は本貫に送還すること（軍防令）などの規定が存在した。
sen.e: There also existed some provisions; expulsion of a student of Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the ritsuryo system) must be noticed to hongan (Gaku-ryo [law on scholarship]); death of an impressed laborer before returning must be noticed to hongan (Fueki-ryo [law on tax]); chonai and shijin (lower rank officers) whose master died must be returned to hongan (Senjo-ryo [law on recruitment and promotion of government officials]); sakimori (soldiers deployed for boarder defences) who fell sick must be returned to hongan (Gunbo-ryo [law on military defence]).

Furthermore, there were stipulations such as when a student withdrew from Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the Ritsuryo system) notification must be made to hongan (Gaku-ryo [law on scholarship]); when a commandeered laborer died before his return, notification must be made to hongan (Fueki-ryo [law on tax]); chonai and shijin (lower rank officers) whose master died must be returned to hongan (Senjo-ryo [law on recruitment and promotion of government officials]); and sakimori (soldiers deployed for boarder defenses) who fell sick must be returned to hongan (Gunbo-ryo [law on military defense]).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。また、綴りをアメリカ式に致しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, there were stipulations such as when a student withdrew from Daigaku-ryo (Bureau of Education under the Ritsuryo system) notification must be made to hongan (Gaku-ryo [law on scholarship]); when a commandeered laborer died before his return, notification must be made to hongan (Fueki-ryo [law on tax]); chonai and shijin (lower rank officers) whose master died must be returned to hongan (Senjo-ryo [law on recruitment and promotion of government officials]); and sakimori (soldiers deployed for boarder defenses) who fell sick must be returned to hongan (Gunbo-ryo [law on military defense]).

sen.j: その後、平安時代末期以降に勃興した武士階級が、所領とした土地（名田）を名字（苗字）とするようになった。
sen.e: Later, the samurai class which began its rise after the late Heian Period started to use their territory land (myoden) as their surname (myoji).
Later, the samurai class that suddenly rose to power after the late Heian Period began using their territory land (myoden) as their surname (myoji).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Later, the samurai class that suddenly rose to power after the late Heian Period began using their territory land (myoden) as their surname (myoji).

sen.j: これに伴い、「苗字の地」を「本貫」「本貫地」と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: After that, the ''land of the surname' was called 'hongan' or 'honganchi.'
With this, the ''land of the surname' was called 'hongan' or 'honganchi.'
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: With this, the ''land of the surname' was called 'hongan' or 'honganchi.'

sen.j: たとえば毛利氏の本貫地は相模国毛利荘、尼子氏の本貫地は近江国甲良荘尼子郷である。
sen.e: For example, honganchi of the Mori clan is Mori-no-sho in Sagami Province, and that of the Amago clan is Amago-go, Kora-no-sho in Omi Province.
For example, honganchi of the Mori clan was Mori-no-sho in Sagami Province, and that of the Amago clan was Amago-go, Kora-no-sho in Omi Province.
sen.cmt: 過去形に修正致しました。
sen.e: For example, honganchi of the Mori clan was Mori-no-sho in Sagami Province, and that of the Amago clan was Amago-go, Kora-no-sho in Omi Province.

tit.cmt: 複数形に修正致しました。

sen.j: 本貫地に祀られている神を、「産土神（うぶすながみ）」と称するため、本貫を（うぶすな）と訓み、次第に「氏神（うじがみ）」と同意語となった。
sen.e: Since the deity enshrined in honganchi was called 'Ubusunagami' (guardian deity of one's birthplace), Hongan was also called Ubusuna, and gradually became a synonym of 'Ujigami' (guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion).

Since the deity enshrined in honganchi was called 'Ubusunagami' (guardian deity of one's birthplace), Hongan was also called Ubusuna, and gradually became a synonym of 'Ujigami' (guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion).

Since the deity enshrined in honganchi was called 'Ubusunagami' (guardian deity of one's birthplace), Hongan was also called Ubusuna, and gradually became a synonym of 'Ujigami' (guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion).

sen.j: 同一の氏族のルーツを表すモノである、同姓の場合でも本貫が違えば別の氏族と見なされる。
sen.e: When the family name which shows the roots of the same clan is same, and yet the hongan is different, it is considered to be a different clan.
Although the family name, which describes the origin of the same clan, is the same, it was considered a different clan when the hongan was different.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Although the family name, which describes the origin of the same clan, is the same, it was considered a different clan when the hongan was different.

sen.j: 逆に異姓でも同一の本貫と見なされる場合もわずかだが有る。
sen.e: On the contrary, there are a few cases considered to be have the same hongan even with a different family name.
On the contrary, there were a few cases where it was considered as the same hongan even if the family names were different.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: On the contrary, there were a few cases where it was considered as the same hongan even if the family names were different.

sen.j: 朝鮮の姓は約250と少なく、金、李、朴、崔、鄭（5大姓）などの姓が多数を占めるため、本貫と姓をつなげる事でお互いを区別してきた面もある。
sen.e: Since the family names in Korea are only about 250, and names like Kim, Ri, Bag, Choe and Jeong (five major names) hold a majority, they have identified each other by linking the hongan and family name.

Since there are only about 250 family names in Korea and family names such as Kim, Ri, Bag, Choe, and Jeong (the five major names) hold a majority, people have identified each other by connecting hongan and the family names.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Since there are only about 250 family names in Korea and family names such as Kim, Ri, Bag, Choe, and Jeong (the five major names) hold a majority, people have identified each other by connecting hongan and the family names.

sen.j: たとえば金姓の場合、金海伽耶(駕洛国)王族系と新羅王族系と全く血統の違う氏族が在るために本貫は氏族を区別する為の有効な手段であった。
sen.e: In the case of the family name Kim, for instance, hongan has been an effective measure to distinguish clans because there exist the royal family of Gimhae Gaya (in Gaya) and the royal family of Silla, which are clans with totally different lines.

For instance, in the case of the family name of Kim, hongan was an effective measure in distinguishing clans, since there was the royal family of Gimhae Gaya (in Gaya) and the royal family of Silla, which were clans with completely different lineage.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: For instance, in the case of the family name of Kim, hongan was an effective measure in distinguishing clans, since there was the royal family of Gimhae Gaya (in Gaya) and the royal family of Silla, which were clans with completely different lineage.

sen.j: 韓国の本貫では先祖の中の偉大な人物を始祖と呼び、その人物かその子孫が住み着いた土地や封じられた場所などを本貫とする。
sen.e: In South Korea, they call the greatest figure in their ancestor Shiso (founder), and the place where he or his descendants settled down or were appointed are regarded as hongan.
In South Korea, the greatest figure among one's ancestor was referred to as Shiso (founder), and the place where he or his descendants settled down or were appointed were regarded as hongan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: In South Korea, the greatest figure among one's ancestor was referred to as Shiso (founder), and the place where he or his descendants settled down or were appointed were regarded as hongan.

sen.j: また、中興の祖を中始祖と呼ぶ場合もある。
sen.e: And the father of restoration is sometimes called Chushiso.
In addition, there are also cases where the founder of restoration is referred to as Chushiso.
sen.cmt: father of restorationという表現をより自然な形になるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: In addition, there are also cases where the founder of restoration is referred to as Chushiso.

sen.j: 本貫を使って人物を説明する場合、始祖から何代目と数えることが多い。
sen.e: A person is mostly introduced with the chronological order from his Shiso when using the hongan.
There are many cases where the number of generation is counted from his or her Shiso when hongan is used to describe a person.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: There are many cases where the number of generation is counted from his or her Shiso when hongan is used to describe a person.

sen.j: ただし、複数の始祖を持つ本貫も存在する。
sen.e: However, there exist some hongan having more than one Shiso.
However, there are hongan with multiple Shiso.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: However, there are hongan with multiple Shiso.

sen.j: 始祖の違いや中始祖が異なる場合○○流と流派をつけて区別する。
sen.e: They are distinguished by using a school to call xxx school when the Shiso or Chushiso are different.
They are distinguished by using the name of a school such as XX school when the originators or Chushiso are different.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: They are distinguished by using the name of a school such as XX school when the originators or Chushiso are different.

sen.j: また同本貫でも明らかに異なる場合は別本貫として扱ったり本貫を変えるケースがある。
sen.e: When having the same hongan and yet being obviously different, it may be treated as another hongan, or may change the hongan.
Also, even with the same hongan, if its difference is obvious, there are cases where it is treated as another hongan or making changes to the hongan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Also, even with the same hongan, if its difference is obvious, there are cases where it is treated as another hongan or making changes to the hongan.

sen.j: たとえば、金海金氏の場合、金官伽耶王族を祖とする本貫と沙也可などを祖とする贈金海金氏、新羅王族の末裔を称し、金海を本貫にした金氏（後に金寧金氏と改称した）が存在した。
sen.e: In the case of the Gimhae Kim clan, for instance, there existed the hongan having the royal family of Gimgwan Gaya as its founder, the Jeung Gimhae Kim clan having Sayaka as its founder, and the Kim clan (they later changed their name to the Gimnyeong Kim clan) calling themselves the descendants of the royal family of Silla and having Gimhae as its hongan.

For example, in the case of the Gimhae Kim clan, there was the hongan having the royal family of Gimgwan Gaya as its founder, the Jeung Gimhae Kim clan having Sayaka as its founder, and the Kim clan (they later changed their name to the Gimnyeong Kim clan) claimed themselves as the descendants of the royal family of Silla and having Gimhae as its hongan.
sen.cmt: 「存在した」にexistを用いるのは誤りではありませんが、"be"を使いより平易な文となるよう修正致しました。
sen.e: For example, in the case of the Gimhae Kim clan, there was the hongan having the royal family of Gimgwan Gaya as its founder, the Jeung Gimhae Kim clan having Sayaka as its founder, and the Kim clan (they later changed their name to the Gimnyeong Kim clan) claimed themselves as the descendants of the royal family of Silla and having Gimhae as its hongan.

sen.j: また、安東金氏にも新羅王族の末裔を称する金氏（旧安東金氏）と高麗建国の功臣を祖とする新安東金氏がある。
sen.e: The Andong Kim clan also has the Kim clan (the old Andong Kim clan) calling themselves the descendants of the royal family of Silla, and the new Andong Kim clan having a meritorious retainer for establishment of Goryeo as its founder.

In addition, the Andong Kim clan also includes the Kim clan (the old Andong Kim clan) claiming themselves as the descendants of the royal family of Silla, and the new Andong Kim clan having a meritorious retainer for establishment of Goryeo as its founder.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: In addition, the Andong Kim clan also includes the Kim clan (the old Andong Kim clan) claiming themselves as the descendants of the royal family of Silla, and the new Andong Kim clan having a meritorious retainer for establishment of Goryeo as its founder.

sen.j: 同じ本貫の場合、名前を付ける場合に行列字などを用いて同じ代同士は同じ漢字を使って人名朝鮮人の名前するケースも多い。
sen.e: When the hongan is same, Koretsuji (generational character) is used when they are named, and the same Chinese character is used to name the same generation in most cases.
sen.cmt: 「人名朝鮮人の名前」はサイト上では「命名」となっているのでそのとおり訳出
sen.e: When the hongan is the same, one is named by the use of Koretsuji (generational character) and so on, and in most cases, the same Chinese character is used to name those who are of the same generation.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: When the hongan is the same, one is named by the use of Koretsuji (generational character) and so on, and in most cases, the same Chinese character is used to name those who are of the same generation.

sen.j: 本貫の管理は、族譜を作成して行われる。
sen.e: Hongan is managed by creating zokufu (record of family lines).
Hongan is managed by creating zokufu (record of family lines).
Hongan is managed by creating zokufu (record of family lines).

sen.j: この風習は中国から入ってきたと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that this custom has come from China.
It is said that this custom was introduced from China.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: It is said that this custom was introduced from China.

sen.j: 李氏朝鮮時代（1392年-1910年）に火事に遭った場合最初に持ち出すのは族譜と言われたほど重要な地位を占めていた。
sen.e: It is said that, in the period of Yi Dynasty Korea (1392-1910), the first thing to bring out in case of fire was zokufu, which occupied an important position.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: Zokufu held such an important position that during the period of Yi Dynasty Korea (1392-1910), that the first thing to save in case of fire was zokufu.
sen.cmt: 前のセルにおいてit is saidを使用しているため、繰返しを避ける文章に修正致しました。
sen.e: Zokufu held such an important position that during the period of Yi Dynasty Korea (1392-1910), that the first thing to save in case of fire was zokufu.

sen.j: 朝鮮半島で最初に作られた族譜は、1403年に作られた水原白氏の族譜とされる。
sen.e: The first zokufu made in the Korean Peninsula is said to be the zokufu of the Suwon Paik clan made in 1403.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理「水原白氏」は用語登録には読み不明となっていましたが、下記参照しました。http://www.absoluteastronomy.com/topics/Yellow_Emperor
sen.e: The first zokufu made in the Korean Peninsula is said to be the zokufu of the Suwon Paik clan made in 1403.
The first zokufu made in the Korean Peninsula is said to be the zokufu of the Suwon Paik clan made in 1403.

sen.j: ただし、この族譜は序文しか残っていない。
sen.e: However only the forward of this zokufu remains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: However, only its preface is handed down.
sen.cmt: prefaceの方が意味が伝わり易いと判断し、修正致しました。
sen.e: However, only its preface is handed down.

sen.j: 15世紀から族譜の作成が行われていたものの本格的に族譜が作られるのは16世紀以降になってからだと言われている。
sen.e: Although zokufu has been created since the 15th century, it is said to be after the 16th century when zokufu was officially created.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: Although zokufu has been created since the 15th century, it is said to be after the 16th century when zokufu was officially created.
Although zokufu has been created since the 15th century, it is said to be after the 16th century when zokufu was officially created.

sen.j: 朝鮮に於ける本貫や族譜の役割は、両班が自らの家系の正統性や優秀性を証明する為の側面もある。
sen.e: One of the roles of hongan or zokufu in Korea is that Yangban (traditional ruling class or nobles of dynastic Korea during the Joseon Dynasty) proves the legitimacy and quality of their family lines.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: One of the roles of hongan or zokufu in Korea is for Yangban (traditional ruling class or nobles of dynastic Korea during the Joseon Dynasty) to prove the legitimacy and quality of their family lines.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: One of the roles of hongan or zokufu in Korea is for Yangban (traditional ruling class or nobles of dynastic Korea during the Joseon Dynasty) to prove the legitimacy and quality of their family lines.

sen.j: その性格ゆえか、韓国に多い本貫は、新羅王族系、伽耶王族系（中始祖が統一新羅に貢献した功臣）、新羅豪族・貴族系、高麗の功臣及び中国の著名な学者や武将などの渡来系（ただし、中国渡来系の中で王姓・孫姓などは、渡来系を祖先とする本貫が皆無か由来が不明な小さな本貫のみである）が大半を占める。
sen.e: Due to this attribute, the common hongan in South Korea consist mostly of the royal families of Silla, the royal families of Gaya (their Chushiso were the meritorious retainers who contributed to Tongilsilla), local ruling families and nobles of Silla, meritorious retainers of Goryeo, and immigrants such as Chinese famous scholars and military commanders (However, Wang families or Son families among Chinese immigrants have no hongan with the ancestry of the immigrants or small hongan with unclear origin.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: Due to this attribute, the common hongan in South Korea consist mostly of the royal families of Silla, the royal families of Gaya (their Chushiso were the meritorious retainers who contributed to Tongilsilla), local ruling families and nobles of Silla, meritorious retainers of Goryeo, and immigrants such as famous Chinese scholars and military commanders (However, Wang families or Son families among Chinese immigrants have no hongan with the ancestry of the immigrants or small hongan with unclear origin.)
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Due to this attribute, the common hongan in South Korea consist mostly of the royal families of Silla, the royal families of Gaya (their Chushiso were the meritorious retainers who contributed to Tongilsilla), local ruling families and nobles of Silla, meritorious retainers of Goryeo, and immigrants such as famous Chinese scholars and military commanders (However, Wang families or Son families among Chinese immigrants have no hongan with the ancestry of the immigrants or small hongan with unclear origin.)

sen.j: 反面百済系は、旌善全氏、天安全氏の系列、高句麗系は、晋州姜氏ぐらいと極端に少ない。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Baekje line has families of the Jeongseon Jeon clan and the Cheonan Jeon clan, and the Goguryeo line has mainly the Jinju Gang clan, which is extremely minor.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: On the other hand, the Baekje line is extremely limited having families of the Jeongseon Jeon clan and the Cheonan Jeon clan, and the Goguryeo line has mainly the Jinju Gang clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Baekje line is extremely limited having families of the Jeongseon Jeon clan and the Cheonan Jeon clan, and the Goguryeo line has mainly the Jinju Gang clan.

sen.j: 渤海 (国)系に至っては密陽大氏のみである。
sen.e: The Bohai line has even only the Milyang Dae clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: As of the Bohai line, it only had the Milyang Dae clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: As of the Bohai line, it only had the Milyang Dae clan.

sen.j: また、稀に中国国内を本貫とする氏族が存在する（曲阜孔氏など）。
sen.e: Also, clans which have hongan in China thinly exist (such as the Gogbu Gong clan).
Also, there rarely are clans that have hongan in China (such as the Gogbu Gong clan).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Also, there rarely are clans that have hongan in China (such as the Gogbu Gong clan).

sen.j: また、隆盛を誇った家系はそのつど分家し、新たな本貫に別れる場合がある。
sen.e: The family which flourished moves out and sets up a new branch family each time, and may separate into another hongan.
In addition, there are cases where a branch family is established and separate into a new hongan each time families prospered.
sen.cmt: 「また」が訳漏れです。前文にも「また」があるので、'also'ではなく、'in addition'を用いました。
sen.e: In addition, there are cases where a branch family is established and separate into a new hongan each time families prospered.

sen.j: たとえば、新羅王族の慶州金氏の系列では、56代敬順王（新羅最後の王）の3男と4男の子孫が慶州金氏である。
sen.e: In the line of the Gyeongju Kim clan of the royal family of Silla, for instance, the descendants of the third and fourth sons of the 56th King Gyeongsun (the last king of Silla) is the Gyeongju Kim clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: For example, in the line of the Gyeongju Kim clan of the royal family of Silla, the descendants of the third and fourth sons of the 56th King Gyeongsun (the last king of Silla) is the Gyeongju Kim clan.
sen.cmt: For example を原文と同じ文頭に設置すると文が読み易くなると思います。
sen.e: For example, in the line of the Gyeongju Kim clan of the royal family of Silla, the descendants of the third and fourth sons of the 56th King Gyeongsun (the last king of Silla) is the Gyeongju Kim clan.

sen.j: 長男の血統は絶え、次男が羅州金氏、5男が義城金氏、6男が洪州金氏、7男が彦陽金氏、8男が三陟金氏、9男が蔚山金氏と別れている。
sen.e: The blood line of the first son died out, the second son became the Raju Kim clan, the sixth son the Hongju Kim clan, the seventh son the Eonyang Kim clan, the eighth son the Samcheog Kim clan and the ninth son the Ulsan Kim clan separately.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: The blood line of the first son died out, and the line was divided by the second son becoming the Raju Kim clan, the fifth son becoming 義城金氏, the sixth son becoming the Hongju Kim clan, the seventh son becoming Eonyang Kim clan, the eighth son becoming the Samcheog Kim clan, and the ninth son becoming the Ulsan Kim clan.
sen.cmt: 「と別れている」をseparatelyで訳されておりますが、それだけでは原文の意味が伝えきれていないと判断し、'and the line was divided by'に修正致しました。また、「5男が義城金氏」が訳漏れです。
sen.e: The blood line of the first son died out, and the line was divided by the second son becoming the Raju Kim clan, the fifth son becoming 義城金氏, the sixth son becoming the Hongju Kim clan, the seventh son becoming Eonyang Kim clan, the eighth son becoming the Samcheog Kim clan, and the ninth son becoming the Ulsan Kim clan.

sen.j: 4男の血統は更に細かく別れ、安東金氏、金寧金氏などの大族を抱えている。
sen.e: The blood line of the fourth son is separated into smaller groups, and has a big family including the Andong Kim clan and the Gimnyeong Kim clan.
The blood line of the fourth son is separated further into smaller groups, and has big families including the Andong Kim clan and the Gimnyeong Kim clan.
sen.cmt: 「更に」が訳漏れです。また、a big familyを複数形に修正致しました。１つの氏だけではないからです。
sen.e: The blood line of the fourth son is separated further into smaller groups, and has big families including the Andong Kim clan and the Gimnyeong Kim clan.

sen.j: また、54代景明王の子孫も長男の密陽朴氏を初めとして10以上の本貫に別れている。
sen.e: The descendants of the 54th King Gyeongmyeong are also separated into more than ten hongan including his first son's Milyang bag clan.
Moreover, the descendants of the 54th King Gyeongmyeong are also separated into more than ten hongan including his first son's Milyang bag clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Moreover, the descendants of the 54th King Gyeongmyeong are also separated into more than ten hongan including his first son's Milyang bag clan.

sen.j: しかしながら、李氏朝鮮後期から末期かけて売官や族譜の売買が行われ、血統としての本貫は混乱してしまった。
sen.e: However, from the late to end of Yi Dynasty Korea period, government posts and zokufu were sold, which made hongan as a blood line confusing.
However, government posts and zokufu were sold from the late to the end of Yi Dynasty Korea period, which confused the hongan as blood line.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: However, government posts and zokufu were sold from the late to the end of Yi Dynasty Korea period, which confused the hongan as blood line.

sen.j: 大韓民国では、1997年に憲法裁判所で民法第809条1号が無効と判断されるまで、同姓同本貫の場合の結婚が禁止されていた（同姓同本不婚）。
sen.e: In Republic of Korea, marriage with a person with the same family name and the same hongan was prohibited until the Civil Code Article 809 Section 1 was declared void at the Constitutional Court in 1997 (Marriage ban of the same family name and hongan).

In Republic of Korea, until the Civil Code Article 809 Section 1 was declared void at the Constitutional Court in 1997 (Marriage ban of the same family name and hongan), marriage between those having the same family name and the same hongan was prohibited.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: In Republic of Korea, until the Civil Code Article 809 Section 1 was declared void at the Constitutional Court in 1997 (Marriage ban of the same family name and hongan), marriage between those having the same family name and the same hongan was prohibited.

sen.j: この判決後、同姓同本の事実婚の夫婦が表に出、法律上の夫婦の便宜を受けることが出来るようになった（現在韓国では、八親等内の親戚の結婚は法的に認められない）。
sen.e: After this resolution, de facto marriage couples of the same family name and hongan came out and obtained benefit of becoming legal couples (Today marriage within eighth degree relatives is not legally permitted in South Korea.)

After this ruling, de facto marriage couples with the same family names and hongan surfaced, and had come to be provided with the benefit of lawful marriage (Today marriage within eighth degree relatives is not legally permitted in South Korea).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: After this ruling, de facto marriage couples with the same family names and hongan surfaced, and had come to be provided with the benefit of lawful marriage (Today marriage within eighth degree relatives is not legally permitted in South Korea).

sen.j: （なお、金海金氏と金海許氏と仁川李氏は別姓であるが始祖を同じ金官伽耶の首露王としているため同本貫として扱われ、結婚が認められなかった。）
sen.e: (The Gimhae Kim clan, the Gimhae Heo clan and Incheon Ri clan have different family names, but the earliest ancestor of them was King Suro-wang in Gimgwan Gaya, and they were treated as the same hongan, which prevented them from getting married.)

(The Gimhae Kim clan, the Gimhae Heo clan, and the Incheon Ri clan have different family names, but they share the originator as King Suro-wang in Gimgwan Gaya, and were treated as the same hongan, which prevented them from getting married.)
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: (The Gimhae Kim clan, the Gimhae Heo clan, and the Incheon Ri clan have different family names, but they share the originator as King Suro-wang in Gimgwan Gaya, and were treated as the same hongan, which prevented them from getting married.)

sen.j: 朝鮮民主主義人民共和国では、本貫は廃止されている。
sen.e: In Democratic People's Republic of Korea, hongan has been abolished.
In Democratic People's Republic of Korea, hongan has been abolished.
In Democratic People's Republic of Korea, hongan has been abolished.

sen.j: 金海金氏
sen.e: The Gimhae Kim clan
The Gimhae Kim clan
The Gimhae Kim clan

sen.j: 金官伽耶（駕洛国）の王族をルーツとする氏族。
sen.e: It is a clan having roots in the royal family of Gimgwan Gaya (in Gaya).
A clan having roots in the royal family of Gimgwan Gaya (in Gaya).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: A clan having roots in the royal family of Gimgwan Gaya (in Gaya).

sen.j: 伽耶初代王首露王の子孫と称する。
sen.e: They claim themselves as the descendants of King Suro-wang, the first king of Gaya.
They claim themselves as the descendants of King Suro-wang, the first king of Gaya.
They claim themselves as the descendants of King Suro-wang, the first king of Gaya.

sen.j: 同名の本貫に、文禄の役時の日本の降将沙也可（金忠善）を始祖とするものがあるが別本貫扱いになる。
sen.e: There exists the hongan with the same name, having Sayaka (Kim Chung-seon), a Japanese general who surrendered at the Bunroku campaign, as its earliest ancestor, which is treated as another hongan.

Within the hongan with the same name, there is one that regards Sayaka (Kim Chung-seon) who was a Japanese general who surrendered at the Bunroku campaign as the originator, but it is treated as another hongan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Within the hongan with the same name, there is one that regards Sayaka (Kim Chung-seon) who was a Japanese general who surrendered at the Bunroku campaign as the originator, but it is treated as another hongan.

sen.j: 区別する場合は、前者を駕洛、後者を友鹿と呼ぶ場合がある。
sen.e: The first may be called Gaya, and the latter Uroku when discriminating them.
When making a distinction, there are cases where the former is referred to as Gaya, and the latter as Uroku.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: When making a distinction, there are cases where the former is referred to as Gaya, and the latter as Uroku.

sen.j: 金海許氏は、金官伽耶の首露王の子孫とし、金海金氏と同本貫扱いとする。
sen.e: The Gimhae Heo clan is supposed to be the descendants of King Suro-wang of Gimgwan Gaya, and treated as the same hongan with the Gimhae Kim clan.
The Gimhae Heo clan is considered to be the descendants of King Suro-wang of Gimgwan Gaya, and treated equally with the hongan of the Gimhae Kim clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: The Gimhae Heo clan is considered to be the descendants of King Suro-wang of Gimgwan Gaya, and treated equally with the hongan of the Gimhae Kim clan.

sen.j: これは首露王と王妃許氏の間に10人の息子がおり、そのうち2人に許姓を名乗らせたと言う事から来ている。
sen.e: This stems from the fact that King Suro-wang and his wife from the Heo clan had ten sons, two of which were given the family name of Heo.
This stems from the fact that King Suro-wang and his wife from the Heo clan had ten sons, two of which were given the family name of Heo.
This stems from the fact that King Suro-wang and his wife from the Heo clan had ten sons, two of which were given the family name of Heo.

sen.j: 密陽朴氏
sen.e: The Milyang Bag clan
The Milyang Bag clan
The Milyang Bag clan

sen.j: 新羅景明王の長男朴彦沈をルーツとする氏族。
sen.e: It is a clan having roots in Eonchim BAG, the first son of King Gyeongmyeong of Silla.
A clan having roots in Eonchim BAG, the first son of King Gyeongmyeong of Silla.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: A clan having roots in Eonchim BAG, the first son of King Gyeongmyeong of Silla.

sen.j: 新羅初代王赫居世居西干を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim Hyeokgeose Geoseogan, the first king of Silla, as their first ancestor.
They claim Hyeokgeose Geoseogan, the first king of Silla, as their originator.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: They claim Hyeokgeose Geoseogan, the first king of Silla, as their originator.

sen.j: 全州李氏
sen.e: The Jeonju Ri clan
The Jeonju Ri clan
The Jeonju Ri clan

sen.j: 新羅の高官李翰を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim Han RI, a high official in Silla, as their first ancestor.
They claim Han RI, a high official in Silla, as their originator.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: They claim Han RI, a high official in Silla, as their originator.

sen.j: 李氏朝鮮の初代、李成桂はこの氏族の出とされている。
sen.e: Seong-gye YI, the founder of Yi Dynasty Korea, is said to have been from this clan.
Seong-gye YI, the founder of Yi Dynasty Korea, is said to have originated from this clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Seong-gye YI, the founder of Yi Dynasty Korea, is said to have originated from this clan.

sen.j: 慶州金氏
sen.e: The Gyeongju Kim clan
The Gyeongju Kim clan
The Gyeongju Kim clan

sen.j: 新羅王族をルーツとする氏族。
sen.e: It is a clan having roots in the royal family of Silla.
A clan having roots in the royal family of Silla.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: A clan having roots in the royal family of Silla.

sen.j: 金姓新羅王の祖、金閼智を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim Alji KIM, the first king of Silla with the family name of Kim, as their first ancestor.
They claim Alji KIM, the first king of Silla with the family name of Kim, as their originator.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: They claim Alji KIM, the first king of Silla with the family name of Kim, as their originator.

sen.j: 慶州李氏
sen.e: The Gyeongju Ri clan
The Gyeongju Ri clan
The Gyeongju Ri clan

sen.j: 新羅初期の豪族をルーツとする。
sen.e: It has roots in a local ruling family in the early period of Silla.
It has roots in a local ruling family in the early period of Silla.
It has roots in a local ruling family in the early period of Silla.

sen.j: 始祖を謁平と称し、新羅建国時の6村(新羅六部）の一つ、及梁部の村長をしていた。
sen.e: They claim Alpyeong as their first ancestor, and they served as the village mayor of Keupryang, one of the six villages at the time of establishment of Silla (Silla-Yukbu).
sen.cmt: 「及梁部」は下記参照。http://home.comcast.net/~troygoss/yibk.html「新羅六部」は下記参照。http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110000384034/en
sen.e: They claim Alpyeong as their first ancestor, and they served as the village mayor of Keupryang, one of the six villages at the time of establishment of Silla (Silla-Yukbu).
They claim Alpyeong as their first ancestor, and they served as the village mayor of Keupryang, one of the six villages at the time of establishment of Silla (Silla-Yukbu).

sen.j: 慶州崔氏
sen.e: The Gyeongju Choe clan
The Gyeongju Choe clan
The Gyeongju Choe clan

sen.j: 慶州李氏と同じく、新羅建国時の新羅六部の一つ沙梁部の村長だった蘇伐都利（崔淵源）を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim 蘇伐都利 (Yeonweon CHOE), the village mayor of 沙梁部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their first ancestor just like the Gyeongju Ri clan.
sen.cmt: 蘇伐都利 および 沙梁部 読み不明です。
sen.e: Just as the Gyeongju Ri clan, they claim 蘇伐都利 (Yeonweon CHOE), the village mayor of 沙梁部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Just as the Gyeongju Ri clan, they claim 蘇伐都利 (Yeonweon CHOE), the village mayor of 沙梁部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.

sen.j: 慶州鄭氏
sen.e: The Gyeongju Jeong clan
The Gyeongju Jeong clan
The Gyeongju Jeong clan

sen.j: 新羅建国時の新羅六部の一つ本彼部の村長だった智伯虎を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim Pae ho JI, the village mayor of 本彼部, one of the Silla Yukbu at the time of establishment of Sill, as their first ancestor.
sen.cmt: 本彼部 読み不明です。
sen.e: They claim Pae ho JI, the village mayor of 本彼部, one of the Silla Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: They claim Pae ho JI, the village mayor of 本彼部, one of the Silla Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.

sen.j: 儒理尼師今の時に鄭姓を賜姓されたとしている。
sen.e: It is said that they were bestowed the family name of Jeong at the time of Yuri Isageum.
sen.cmt: 「儒理尼師今」は登録でJuri Nishikinとなっていましたが下記参照して訳出。http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yuri_of_Silla
sen.e: It is said that they were bestowed the family name of Jeong at the time of Yuri Isageum.
It is said that they were bestowed the family name of Jeong at the time of Yuri Isageum.

sen.j: 第42代子孫である鄭珍厚を中祖として本貫を慶州鄭氏とした。
sen.e: Their Chushiso is jinhu JEONG, the 42nd descendants, and their hongan is the Gyeongju Jeong clan.
Their Chushiso is jinhu JEONG, the 42nd descendant, and their hongan is the Gyeongju Jeong clan.
Their Chushiso is jinhu JEONG, the 42nd descendant, and their hongan is the Gyeongju Jeong clan.

sen.j: 智伯虎を先祖とする鄭氏の本家格である。
sen.e: It is the head family of the Jeong clan having Pae ho JI as its ancestor.
It is the head family of the Jeong clan having Pae ho JI as its ancestor.
It is the head family of the Jeong clan having Pae ho JI as its ancestor.

sen.j: 延日鄭氏
sen.e: The Yeonil Jeong clan
The Yeonil Jeong clan
The Yeonil Jeong clan

sen.j: 智伯虎の子孫で、新羅の諫議大夫である鄭宗殷が始祖。
sen.e: They are the descendants of Pae ho JI, and their first ancestor was Jungeun JEONG, a Jianyi Daifu (high steward who argues the politics and remonstrates the emperor) in Silla.
sen.cmt: 「諫議大夫」の読みは下記参照http://www.absoluteastronomy.com/topics/Song_Jing
sen.e: They are the descendants of Pae ho JI, and their originator was Jungeun JEONG, a Jianyi Daifu (high steward who argues the politics and remonstrates the emperor) in Silla.
sen.cmt: first ancestorをoriginatorに置き換えました。
sen.e: They are the descendants of Pae ho JI, and their originator was Jungeun JEONG, a Jianyi Daifu (high steward who argues the politics and remonstrates the emperor) in Silla.

sen.j: 迎日鄭氏、烏川鄭氏ともいう。
sen.e: They are also called the Yeongil Jeong clan or the Ocheon Jeong clan.
They are also called the Yeongil Jeong clan or the Ocheon Jeong clan.
They are also called the Yeongil Jeong clan or the Ocheon Jeong clan.

sen.j: 知奏事公派、監務公派、良肅公派に分かれる。
sen.e: They are separated into Chisoji koha group, Kanmu koha group and Ryoshuku koha group.
sen.cmt: 知奏事公派、監務公派、良肅公派 定訳不明です。
sen.e: They are separated into Chisoji koha group, Kanmu koha group and Ryoshuku koha group.
They are separated into Chisoji koha group, Kanmu koha group and Ryoshuku koha group.

sen.j: 東莱鄭氏
sen.e: The Dongrae Jeong clan
The Dongrae Jeong clan
The Dongrae Jeong clan

sen.j: 智伯虎の子孫で、新羅の安逸戸長である鄭檜文が始祖。
sen.e: They are the descendants of Pae ho JI, and their first ancestor was 鄭檜文, the 安逸戸長 (chieftain for comfort) in Silla.
sen.cmt: 鄭檜文 安逸戸長 読み不明です。
sen.e: They are the descendants of Pae ho JI, and their originator was 鄭檜文, the 安逸戸長 (chieftain for comfort) in Silla.
sen.cmt: first ancestorをoriginatorに置き換えました。
sen.e: They are the descendants of Pae ho JI, and their originator was 鄭檜文, the 安逸戸長 (chieftain for comfort) in Silla.

sen.j: 河東鄭氏
sen.e: The Hadong Jeong clan
The Hadong Jeong clan
The Hadong Jeong clan

sen.j: 同じ本貫ながら、智伯虎の子孫である鄭道正を始祖とする派と、鄭遜位を始祖とする派、鄭膺を始祖とする派がある。
sen.e: There exist a group having Dojeong JEONG, a descendant of Pae ho JI, as the first ancestor, a group having Sonwi JEONG as the first ancestor, and a group having Eung JEONG as the first ancestor, though they are the same hongan.

Although with the same hongan, there are groups having Dojeong JEONG, a descendant of Pae ho JI, as the originator, a group having Sonwi JEONG as the originator, and a group having Eung JEONG as the originator.
sen.cmt: first ancestorをoriginatorに置き換えました。
sen.e: Although with the same hongan, there are groups having Dojeong JEONG, a descendant of Pae ho JI, as the originator, a group having Sonwi JEONG as the originator, and a group having Eung JEONG as the originator.

sen.j: 慶州孫氏
sen.e: The Gyeongju Son clan
The Gyeongju Son clan
The Gyeongju Son clan

sen.j: 新羅建国時の新羅六部の一つ漸梁部の村長だった仇礼馬を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim Ryema GU, the village mayor of 漸梁部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as the first ancestor.
sen.cmt: 漸梁部 読み不明です。
sen.e: They claim Ryema GU who was the village mayor of 漸梁部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.
sen.cmt: first ancestorをoriginatorに置き換えました。
sen.e: They claim Ryema GU who was the village mayor of 漸梁部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.

sen.j: 慶州裵氏
sen.e: The Gyeongju Pe clan
The Gyeongju Pe clan
The Gyeongju Pe clan

sen.j: 新羅建国時の新羅六部の一つ韓岐部の村長だった祇沱を始祖と称する。
sen.e: They claim Ta GI, the village mayor of 韓岐部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as the first ancestor.
sen.cmt: 韓岐部 読み不明です。
sen.e: They claim Ta GI who was the village mayor of 韓岐部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.
They claim Ta GI who was the village mayor of 韓岐部, one of the Silla-Yukbu at the time of establishment of Silla, as their originator.

sen.j: 本来は戸籍が置かれた場所を示した。
sen.e: It originally indicated the place where the family register is put.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: It originally indicated the place where the family register was put.
It originally indicated the place where the family register was put.

sen.j: 士大夫階級にとっての本拠地であり、ほぼ出身地を示していた。
sen.e: It referred to a home ground for shitaifu (Scholar-bureaucrats), which normally indicated their hometown.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: It was meant to be the home ground for shitaifu (Scholar-bureaucrats), which nearly indicated their hometown.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: It was meant to be the home ground for shitaifu (Scholar-bureaucrats), which nearly indicated their hometown.

sen.j: 動乱を経た西晋以降、本貫はその人物の出身地とは乖離して始祖の出自を示す系譜上の意味となった。
sen.e: Since the West Jin period after the turbulent times, hongan has indicated the place of origin of the earliest ancestor with the significance in genealogy, away from a hometown of a person.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: After the upheavals in the West Jin period, hogan was detached from its use as an indication one's birthplace, to a genealogical meaning that indicates the origin of the first ancestor.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: After the upheavals in the West Jin period, hogan was detached from its use as an indication one's birthplace, to a genealogical meaning that indicates the origin of the first ancestor.

sen.j: また貴族 (中国)制社会において同一氏族集団に属することを示した。
sen.e: And it has indicated belonging to the same family clan in the aristocratic society.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: It also indicated within the aristocratic society that one belonged to the same family clan.
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: It also indicated within the aristocratic society that one belonged to the same family clan.

sen.j: 汝南袁氏
sen.e: The Yeonam Weon clan
The Yeonam Weon clan
The Yeonam Weon clan

sen.j: 琅邪王氏
sen.e: The Langye Wang clan
The Langye Wang clan
The Langye Wang clan

sen.j: 潁川陳氏
sen.e: The Yeongcheon Jin clan
The Yeongcheon Jin clan
The Yeongcheon Jin clan

sen.j: 弘農楊氏
sen.e: The Hongnong Yang clan
The Hongnong Yang clan
The Hongnong Yang clan

sen.j: 太原王氏
sen.e: The Taeweon Wang clan
The Taeweon Wang clan
The Taeweon Wang clan

sen.j: 陳郡謝氏
sen.e: The Jingun Sa clan
The Jingun Sa clan
The Jingun Sa clan

sen.j: 華僑・華人の間では、中国における祖先の出身地を示すものとして本貫の語が用いられる（本籍・原籍とも）。
sen.e: The word hongan is used to indicate the hometown of ancestors in China by Chinese residents and Chinese descents living abroad (for both the registered address and the original domicile).

Among the Chinese residents and Chinese descents that are living abroad, the word hongan is used to indicate the hometown of ancestors in China (for both the registered address and the original domicile).
sen.cmt: 表現を修正し、より自然な文体に致しました。
sen.e: Among the Chinese residents and Chinese descents that are living abroad, the word hongan is used to indicate the hometown of ancestors in China (for both the registered address and the original domicile).
